3321961586.given_title: What the sound of your name says about you - BBC Future
3321961586.resolved_title: What the sound of your name says about you
3321961586.excerpt: Picture two cartoon characters, one round and the other spiky. Which would you name Bouba, and which one, Kiki? And which do you then think is more outgoing? Perhaps surprisingly, most of you will probably attribute the same name and characteristics to each of the shapes.

1.caption: People tend to consider the sound of the letter 'i' as spiky while 'o' has a much rounder shape in the mouth

2.caption: The word prickly is as spiky as it sounds, and such associations can help when learning languages

3.caption: Rounder, smoother-sounding names like Molly tend to be associated with being agreeable

4.caption: The way a word feels in your mouth as you say it can trigger some surprising psychological reactions
